body:
I am thinking to buy a new mouse, because the one I have now is pretty crappy.

So I need you guys to tell me what mouse do you think is the best, because I am hearing alot of people saying Razer DeathAdder etc..
Can people tell me what for kind of mouse they use?

Thanks though

-Bart

replies.body:
I currently have the Logitech G600 MMO Mouse and I love it. You can customize profiles for every game and/or program in your computer. I have several keys bound to the mouse so I hardly have to take my hand off WASD. I also use it to easily browse with Google Chrome as well as to save a lot of time when using paint.NET(Photoshop alternative). I had a hard time getting used to it for the first couple of hours but I can't live without it now.

If you want something with less buttons but still plenty of buttons as well as adjustable weight and surface, get the Logitech G502. (Or the G402 if you want something similar but more basic)

If you want something wireless, get the Logitech G700s.

If you don't want as many extra buttons as these mice or something more simple but still good, the Razer Deathadder, Steelseries Rival and Logitech G100s are good choices.

If you're on a budget, the Redragon Centrophorus is the best option for the price.

replies.body:
Razer Naga '14

You can switch through your inventory individually with your thumb.

Being a rusher with this mouse is AMAZING. Ever accidentally pull out your bow instead of your sword at the wrong time, or pull out your gapples instead of a block to save yourself? That's eliminated.

Full inventory control, side scrolling, clicky scroll button for precision..

And neon lights glowing EVERYWHERE optjrgopjrtgopjrogpjorpgjporjgtoptjg

I suggest 4 all. :3

replies.body:
"So I need you guys to tell me what mouse do you think is the best, because I am hearing alot of people saying Razer DeathAdder etc.."

The best mouse depends on your style and what games you like playing.
What games do you play the most? It's very hard to help someone if you don't know what they play!
What do you look for in a mouse? This is also quite important, as it limits options (for example, do you want a backlight? Wireless? Buttons?)

I use a Corsair M65, if you wanted to know.

replies.body:
No one cares.

Anyone who knows even the most remote things about gaming mice is that no one uses anything over 5,000 dpi. It's pointless, and it's just a marketing ploy.

Also, mice are less accurate at higher dpi, generally; they're more made for stuff in the 400-2400 dpi range.

Gotcha m8.

replies.body:
If you are willing to spend 100$, the Mionix Castor is EASILY the best mouse all around, unless you play MMO.

I you can't, the ASUS ROG Gladius is the best 80$ mouse, and the DeathAdder is the best 60$ mouse.

I you can't, the ASUS ROG Gladius is the best 80$ mouse, and the DeathAdder is the best 60$ mouse.

replies.body: That matters on preference. I like the G502 a lot, but IMO the DeathAdder is better because it has nothing wrong with it. The G502's scroll wheel sucks IMO, and its really on the heavy side. The DeathAdder just doesn't have any flaws, which makes it incredible. Though if they made the G502 lighter and made the scroll wheel like the DeathAdder's, it would beat the DA easily.
replies.body_tagged: That matters on preference. I like the G502 a lot, but IMO the DeathAdder is better because it has nothing wrong with it. The G502's scroll wheel sucks IMO, and its really on the heavy side. The DeathAdder just doesn't have any flaws, which makes it incredible. Though if they made the G502 lighter and made the scroll wheel like the DeathAdder's, it would beat the DA easily.

reply_to.body: I'm not going to do research into the Mionix or the ROG, but the DeathAdder is not the best $60 mouse; I'd argue that the best $60 is the Logitech G502.
reply_to.body_tagged: I'm not going to do research into the Mionix or the ROG, but the DeathAdder is not the best $60 mouse; I'd argue that the best $60 is the Logitech G502.

replies.body:
"scroll wheel sucks"

No. It's a dual-mode, which makes it easier to use for both work and play.

"heavy side"

This is the only statement I agree with; Logitech's mice are much heavier, which are better for control; however, I know there are people who don't like that.

"doesn't have any flaws"

Note that you're recommending a mouse that even has it's own named problem, the "double-click problem." Although this doesn't always happen, this shows the terrible build quality that the DA has. The only versions of the DA that are relatively good are the older ones.

Also, the last thing you want to do with a mouse is RMA it six months later; RMA'ing anything sucks, and costs you money as well.

replies.body: The scroll wheel sucks, as in it doesnt have any grip. The dual-mode is incredible, but the click scroll is really bad. Pressing it requires so much force you scroll a couple of clicks instead ._. But thats a matter of preferance. Most of the community doesnt like it. The DA double click problem is easily fixable, if it even breaks. Ive had mine for over 10 months and it hasnt broken yet. And btw, if you say the right thing to Razer if you are using your warranty when it broke, Ive seen cases where they send the Chroma version for free, so free RGB! And also, the DA Chroma has heavier clicks, so it breaking is less likely.
replies.body_tagged: The scroll wheel sucks, as in it doesnt have any grip. The dual-mode is incredible, but the click scroll is really bad. replies.body:
http://www.amazon.com/Razer-DeathAdder-Chroma-Multi-Color-Ergonomic/product-reviews/B00MYTSDU4/ref=c...
Note the reviews are mixed with the negative reviews mostly on build quality.
This is very important, as the last thing you want is a mouse that breaks easily.
Also, note this:
Razer has its equipment built in China.
Logitech G AFAIK has its equipment built in Switzerland.
The two mice sell at a similar price.
That should tell you something about their business models.

I own a DeathAdder Chroma mouse and keyboard have had absolutely ZERO problems with the deathadder.
